TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Project extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a project with design time semantics. This class can load project files, edit items and properties and build projects.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Constructs an empty project using the global project collection global properties and default tools version.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This project is added to the global project collection when it is given the full path to the source project file, typically by saving the project.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectRootElement xml) cil managed

Docs.param: ProjectRootElement to use for evaluation.
Docs.summary: Constructs an empty project and evaluates it using the given project root and the global project collection global properties and default tools version.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This project is added to the global project collection when either this project or the given project root is given the full path to the source project file.
Throws InvalidProjectFileException if the evaluation fails. Throws InvalidOperationException if there is already an equivalent project loaded in the project collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectCollection projectCollection) cil managed

Docs.param: The project collection that the new project is added to.
Docs.summary: Constructs an empty project using the given project collection global properties and default tools version.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This project is added to the given project collection when it is given the full path to the source project file, typically by saving the project.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string projectFile) cil managed

Docs.param: The source project file to be evaluated.
Docs.summary: Constructs a project and evaluates it from the given source project file and with the global project collection global properties and default tools version.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The project is added to the global project collection.
Throws InvalidOperationException if there is already a project in the project collection that evaluates this source project file. May throw IO-related exceptions.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Xml.XmlReader xmlReader) cil managed

Docs.param: Xml reader to read project source code from.
Docs.summary: Constructs a project and evaluates the source code from the given XML reader. The source code is evaluated with the global project collection global properties and default tools version.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This project is added to the global project collection when it is given the full path to the source project file, typically by saving the project.
Throws InvalidProjectFileException if the evaluation fails. Throws InvalidOperationException if there is already an equivalent project loaded in the project collection.

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectRootElement xml, class System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2<string, string> globalProperties, string toolsVersion) cil managed

Docs.param: The project root to use for evaluation.
Global properties to evaluate with. May be null in which case the containing project collection's global properties will be used.
Tools version to evaluate with. May be null.
Docs.summary: Constructs an empty project and evaluates it using the given project root and with the given global properties and given tools version.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This project is added to the global project collection when either this project or the given project root is given the full path to the source project file.
Throws InvalidProjectFileException if the evaluation fails. Throws InvalidOperationException if there is already an equivalent project loaded in the project collection.

The tools version used to evaluate the project. May be null.
The project collection the new project will be added to.
Docs.summary: Constructs an empty project, to be evaluated with the given project collection and with the given global properties and given tools version.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The project is added to the specified project collection when it is given the full path to the source project file, typically by saving the project.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectItem> AddItem(string itemType, string unevaluatedInclude) cil managed

Docs.param: The item type of the added item.
Include attribute of the item to be added.
Docs.summary: Adds an item with no metadata to the project.
Docs.returns: Returns the added item.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Any metadata can be added later. Does not modify the project source if a wildcard expression already includes the new item.
Evaluation takes place on a best-effort basis. Items that are defined in the project source following the new item may be used for evaluation. Only this item is evaluated. Other items that might depend on it are not affected.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Collections.Generic.IList<Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectItem> AddItem (string itemType, string unevaluatedInclude, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair<string,string>> metadata);

.method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectItem> AddItem(string itemType, string unevaluatedInclude, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<valuetype System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair`2<string, string>> metadata) cil managed

Docs.param: The item type of the added item.
Include attribute of the item to be added.
The metadata of the added item.
Docs.summary: Adds an item with the given metadata to the project.
Docs.returns: Returns the added item.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The metadata may be null, which indicates no metadata.
Evaluation takes place on a best-effort basis. Items that are defined in the project source following the new item may be used for evaluation. Only this item is evaluated. Other items that might depend on it are not affected.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectItem> AddItemFast(string itemType, string unevaluatedInclude) cil managed

Docs.param: The item type to be added.
The unevaluated Include attribute to be added to the item.
Docs.summary: Adds an item with no metadata to the project. Makes no effort to see if an existing wildcard would already match the new item, unless it is the first item in an item group. Makes no effort to locate the new item near similar items.
Docs.returns: Returns a list of the project items added.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Appends the item to the first item group that does not have a condition and has either no children or whose first child is an item of the same type.
Evaluates on a best-effort basis: -expands with all items. Items that are defined in the XML below the new item may be used, even though in a real evaluation they would not be.
Only this item is evaluated. Other items that might depend on it are not affected.
This is a convenience that it is understood does not necessarily leave the project in a perfectly self consistent state until reevaluation.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Collections.Generic.IList<Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectItem> AddItemFast (string itemType, string unevaluatedInclude, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair<string,string>> metadata);

.method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectItem> AddItemFast(string itemType, string unevaluatedInclude, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<valuetype System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair`2<string, string>> metadata) cil managed

Docs.param: The item type to be added.
The unevaluated Include attribute to be added to the item.
The metadata to be added.
Docs.summary: Adds an item with metadata to the project. Metadata may be null, indicating no metadata. Makes no effort to see if an existing wildcard would already match the new item, unless it is the first item in an item group. Makes no effort to locate the new item near similar items.
Docs.returns: Returns a list of the project items added.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Appends the item to the first item group that does not have a condition and has either no children or whose first child is an item of the same type.
Evaluates on a best-effort basis: -expands with all items. Items that are defined in the XML below the new item may be used, even though in a real evaluation they would not be.
Only this item is evaluated. Other items that might depend on it is not affected.
This is a convenience that it is understood does not necessarily leave the project in a perfectly self consistent state until reevaluation.

Docs.summary: Gets all item definition metadata encountered during evaluation.
Docs.value: Returns all item definition metadata encountered during evaluation. This does not include any elements whose conditions did not evaluate to true, nor any item definition metadata added since the last evaluation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Item metadata is read during the second evaluation pass. Unlike metadata returned by the ItemDefinitions property, this metadata is ordered, and includes any metadata subsequently overridden with the same name and item type.

Docs.summary: Gets an enumerator over all items encountered during evaluation. These are read during the third evaluation pass.
Docs.value: Returns an enumerator over all items encountered during evaluation. These are read during the third evaluation pass.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Unlike those items returned by the Items property, these are ordered with respect to all other items encountered during evaluation, not just ordered with respect to items of the same item type.
In some applications, this complete mutual ordering is significant, and such hosts can use this property.
The enumeration does not include any elements whose conditions did not evaluate to true, nor does it include any items added since the last evaluation.

Docs.summary: Gets all properties encountered during evaluation.
Docs.value: Returns all properties encountered during evaluation. This does not include any properties whose conditions did not evaluate to true, nor any properties added since the last evaluation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks These properties are read during the first evaluation pass. Unlike properties returned by the Properties property, these are ordered, and includes any properties subsequently overridden with the same name.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool Build() cil managed

Docs.summary: Builds this project, using the default targets.
Docs.returns: Returns true on success; false otherwise.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To set or get virtual items for build purposes, clone a project instance explicitly and build that. This method does not modify the project object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To set or get virtual items for build purposes, clone a project instance explicitly and build that. This method does not modify the project object.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of possible property values for properties used to evaluate conditions found on properties, property groups, imports, and whens.
Docs.value: Returns a collection of possible property values for properties used to evaluate conditions found on properties, property groups, imports, and whens. The collection is in canonical form. The name of the entry is the name of the property to be evaluated, and the value is a list of possible property values.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For example, if the following conditions existed on properties in a project: Condition="'$(Configuration)|$(Platform)' == 'Debug|x86'" Condition="'$(Configuration)' == 'Release'" the table would be populated with { "Configuration", { "Debug", "Release" }} { "Platform", { "x86" }} This collection is used by Visual Studio to determine the configurations defined in the project

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectInstance CreateProjectInstance() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a project instance based on this project, but completely disconnected from it.
Docs.returns: Returns the project instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Can be used to build independently. The original project is evaluated before creating the instance, if necessary, so that the original project is marked as unmodified.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectInstance CreateProjectInstance(valuetype Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectInstanceSettings settings) cil managed

Docs.param: Determines whether created project instance is immutable and whether it contains a look up table to improve performance.
Docs.summary: Creates a project instance based on this project, but completely disconnected from it.
Docs.returns: Returns the project instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Can be used to build independently. The original project is evaluated before creating the instance, if necessary, so that the original project is marked as unmodified.

Docs.summary: Gets the root directory for this project.
Docs.value: Returns the root directory for this project. The root directory is never null; in-memory projects use the current directory at the time of project load.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a flag the determines whether <xref:Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project.MarkDirty%2A> is temporarily disabled. This allows, for example, a global property to be set without the project getting marked dirty for reevaluation as a consequence.
Docs.value: Returns a flag the determines whether is temporarily disabled.

Docs.summary: Gets a number that is incremented every time that project is re-evaluated.
Docs.value: Returns the incremented value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This value should be compared with previous values to see if the project has been re-evaluated. It should not be used to determine how many times the project has been re-evaluated since it may be incremented by more than one for a given re-evaluation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance string ExpandString(string unexpandedValue) cil managed

Docs.param: The string to be evaluated.
Docs.summary: Evaluates the given string by expanding items and properties. The string is evaluated as if it were found at the very end of the project file.
Docs.returns: Returns the evaluated string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method can be used when best-effort evaluation is sufficient.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the full path to the project source file.
Docs.value: Returns the full path to the project source file. Returns an empty string if the project was not loaded from disk.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Setting this property on a project in a project collection renames the project.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig string GetEvaluatedItemIncludeEscaped(class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectItem item) cil managed

Docs.param: The item to be evaluated and escaped.
Docs.summary: Gets evaluated, escaped value of the Include attribute of the provided items.
Docs.returns: Returns the evaluated, escaped value of the Include attribute of the provided items.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig string GetEvaluatedItemIncludeEscaped(class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectItemDefinition item) cil managed

Docs.param: The item definition to be evaluated and escaped.
Docs.summary: Gets the evaluated, escaped value of the Include attribute of the provided item definition.
Docs.returns: Returns the value of the Include attribute.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1<class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectItem> GetItems(string itemType) cil managed

Docs.param: The item type to be retrieved.
Docs.summary: Gets all the items in the project of the given item type. If there are none, returns an empty list. Use AddItem or RemoveItem to modify items in this project.
Docs.returns: Returns all the items in the project of the given item type. Returns an empty list if there are no items with the given item name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use AddItem or RemoveItem to modify items in this project.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1<class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectItem> GetItemsByEvaluatedInclude(string evaluatedInclude) cil managed

Docs.param: The evaluated Include attribute.
Docs.summary: Gets all items that have the given evaluated Include attribute.
Docs.returns: Returns all items that have the given evaluated Include attribute.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For example, this method might return all items that have the evaluated Include attribute "component.cpp". Typically zero or one items are returned. However, there may be multiple items with the same path and different item types, or even with the same item types.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1<class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectItem> GetItemsIgnoringCondition(string itemType) cil managed

Docs.param: The item type to be retrieved.
Docs.summary: Gets all the items in the project of the given type, whether or not their Condition attribute evaluates to true. This is a read-only list: use AddItem or RemoveItem to modify items in this project.
Docs.returns: Returns all the items in the project of the given type, whether or not their Condition attribute evaluates to true.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is a read-only list. Use AddItem or RemoveItem to modify items in this project.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectElement> GetLogicalProject() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets an enumerator over all the elements in the "logical project". The logical project is defined as the unevaluated project obtained from the single MSBuild file that is the result of inlining the text of all imports of the original MSBuild project manifest file.
Docs.returns: Returns an enumerator over all the elements in the "logical project".

remarks.format: ## Remarks The logical project is defined as the unevaluated project obtained from the single MSBuild file that is the result of including inline the text of all imports of the original MSBuild project manifest file.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig string GetMetadataValueEscaped(class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectMetadata metadatum) cil managed

Docs.param: The metadatum to be escaped.
Docs.summary: Gets the escaped value of the provided metadatum.
Docs.returns: Gets the escaped value of the provided metadatum.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string GetMetadataValueEscaped (Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectItem item, string name);
.method public static hidebysig string GetMetadataValueEscaped(class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectItem item, string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The item whose metadata is to be escaped.
The name of the metadata to be escaped.
Docs.summary: Gets the escaped value of the metadatum with the provided name on the provided item.
Docs.returns: Gets the escaped value of the metadatum with the provided name on the provided item.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string GetMetadataValueEscaped (Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectItemDefinition item, string name);
.method public static hidebysig string GetMetadataValueEscaped(class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectItemDefinition item, string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The item definition whose metadata is to be escaped.
The name of the metadata to be escaped.
Docs.summary: Gets the escaped value of the metadatum with the provided name on the provided item definition.
Docs.returns: Returns the escaped value of the metadatum with the provided name on the provided item definition.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectProperty GetProperty(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the property to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Gets any property in the project that has the specified name.
Docs.returns: Returns any property in the project that has the specified name. Returns null if no property of that name exists.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance string GetPropertyValue(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the property whose value is retrieved.
Docs.summary: Gets the value of the given property in this project.
Docs.returns: Returns the value of the given property in this project. Return an empty string if no property of that name exists. Escape sequences are converted before returning the string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A property with a value of empty string and no property at all are not distinguished between by this method. To determine if a property is set at all in the project, use GetProperty(name).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig string GetPropertyValueEscaped(class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectProperty property) cil managed

Docs.param: The property to be escaped.
Docs.summary: Get the escaped value of the provided property.
Docs.returns: Returns the escaped value of the provided property.

Docs.summary: Gets a dictionary of the global properties used for the evaluation of this project.
Docs.value: Returns a dictionary of the global properties used for the evaluation of this project.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This is the publicly exposed getter, that translates into a read-only dead IDictionary\<string, string>.
In order to easily tell when we're dirtied, setting and removing global properties is done with <xref:Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project.SetGlobalProperty%2A> and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project.RemoveGlobalProperty%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets a list of all the files that contributed to the evaluation of this project.
Docs.value:
Returns a list of all the files that contributed to the evaluation of this project.
The name of each item is the Import element that caused the file to be imported. The value of each item is the project root of the imported project. Import elements whose Condition attribute evaluated to false are not included.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The project root of this project is not included.

Docs.summary: Gets a list of duplicate imports if an import was imported multiple times. However, only the first import was used in evaluation.
Docs.value: Returns a list of duplicate imports.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that selects whether the targets and tasks of this project can be built.
Docs.value: Returns true if the targets and tasks of this project can be built; false otherwise.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Can be used for security purposes. By default, a new project has the same IsBuildEnabled setting as the parent project collection that contains it. When IsBuildEnabled is false, the Build method on this project fails.

Docs.summary: Gets a property that indicates whether this project has been modified so that it must be reevaluated.
Docs.value: Returns a property that indicates whether this project has been modified so that it must be reevaluated.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A project is modified and must be reevaluated when the underlying project source code, including changes to imported files. A project is also modified must be reevaluated if the project tool set changes.

Docs.summary: Gets a dictionary of item definitions in this project, keyed by item type.
Docs.value: Returns a dictionary of item definitions in this project, keyed by item type.

Docs.summary: Gets an enumerator over all items in this project, ordered within groups of item types.
Docs.value: Returns an enumerator over all items in this project, ordered within groups of item types.

Docs.summary: Gets an enumerator over all items in this project, ordered within groups of item types.
Docs.value: Returns an enumerator over all items in this project., ordered within groups of item types, including items whose conditions evaluate to false, or are contained within item groups whose condition evaluates to false.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Can be used to display all items, even if they are not part of the build in the current configuration.

Docs.summary: Gets an enumerator over all item types in this project.
Docs.value: Returns an enumerator over all item types in this project. This is an ordered collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void MarkDirty() cil managed

Docs.summary: Marks this project as modified.

remarks.format:
## Remarks It is seldom necessary to call this method explicitly, because all edits affecting a project automatically mark it as modified.
Sometimes, however, this method must be called. For example, a project may have an Import element whose condition depends on a file that exists on a disk. If that file does not exist at evaluation time, and it is created after evaluation, then the project must be explicitly marked as modified.
The <xref:Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project.ReevaluateIfNecessary%2A> method uses this property to determine if an evaluation is necessary.

Docs.summary: Gets the project collection which contains this project.
Docs.value: Returns the project collection which contains this project, which is never null.

Docs.summary: The location of the originating file itself, not any specific content within it. If the file has not been given a name, this is an empty location. This is a legitimate case of having no location.
Docs.value: Returns the originating file location or an empty location.

Docs.summary: Gets an enumerator over all properties in this project. This is an unordered collection.
Docs.value: Returns an enumerator over all properties in this project. Since properties are evaluated as they appear, this is an unordered collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void ReevaluateIfNecessary() cil managed

Docs.summary: Reevaluates the project to incorporate any changes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The project is reevaluated only if it is marked as modified. Reevaluation incorporates all changes made to the project source code.
Throws InvalidProjectFileException if the evaluation fails.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool RemoveGlobalProperty(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the global property to be removed.
Docs.summary: Removes a global property and marks the project as modified.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the value of the global property was set.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool RemoveItem(class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectItem item) cil managed

Docs.param: The item to be removed.
Docs.summary: Removes an item from the project. The item to be removed must be present in the project, and must not originate from an imported file.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the item is present in this evaluated project; otherwise false. Normally this method returns true, since if the requested item is not present, the method throws an exception. If the item is present only in the ItemsIgnoringCondition collection, however, the method returns false.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the item group containing the item becomes empty, it is also removed.
If the item originates from a wildcard or semicolon-separated expression, the expression is first expanded into multiple items.
The project is updated, but no further evaluation occurs until reevaluation. For example, if an item of type "i" is removed, "j" which is evaluated from "@(i)" is not modified until reevaluation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RemoveItems(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectItem> items) cil managed

Docs.param: The items to be removed.
Docs.summary: Removes all the given items from the project, unless they originate from an imported project.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If an item originates from an imported project, it is simply skipped.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool RemoveProperty(class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectProperty property) cil managed

Docs.param: The property to remove.
Docs.summary: Removes an property from the project. The property to be removed must be present in the project, and must not originate from an imported file.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the property is present in this evaluated project; otherwise false.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the property group containing the property becomes empty, it is also removed.
The project is updated, but no further evaluation occurs until reevaluation. For example, if "p" is removed, "q" which is evaluated from "$(p)" is not modified until reevaluation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Save() cil managed

Docs.summary: Saves the project to the file system, if modified, using the default character encoding.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Save(class System.IO.TextWriter writer) cil managed

Docs.param: The text writer to save the project to.
Docs.summary: Saves the project to the provided text writer, whether or not the project has been modified. Uses the character encoding of the text writer and marks the project as unmodified.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Save(string path) cil managed

Docs.param: The path to the project source code.
Docs.summary: Saves the project to the file system, if modified or if the path to the project source code changes, using the default character encoding.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Save(class System.Text.Encoding encoding) cil managed

Docs.param: The character encoding used to save the project.
Docs.summary: Saves the project to the file system, if modified, using the given character encoding.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Save (string path, System.Text.Encoding encoding);
.method public hidebysig instance void Save(string path, class System.Text.Encoding encoding) cil managed

Docs.param: The path to the project source code.
The character encoding used to save the project.
Docs.summary: Saves the project to the file system, if modified or if the path to the project source code changes, using the given character encoding.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SaveLogicalProject(class System.IO.TextWriter writer) cil managed

Docs.param: The writer that saves the project file.
Docs.summary: Saves a "logical" or "preprocessed" project file, that includes all the imported files as if they formed a single file.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool SetGlobalProperty (string name, string escapedValue);
.method public hidebysig instance bool SetGlobalProperty(string name, string escapedValue) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the global property to set.
The new value of the global property.
Docs.summary: Sets a global property after the project has been evaluated. If the value changes, the project is marked to require reevaluation.
Docs.returns: Returns if the value changes, otherwise returns .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectProperty SetProperty(string name, string unevaluatedValue) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the property to set.
The new unevaluated value of the property.
Docs.summary: Sets or adds a property with the given name and value to the project. Overwrites the value of a property with the same name if it did not originate in an imported file.
Docs.returns: Returns the property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If there is no property with the given name, updates the last existing property with the given name that has no condition on itself or its property group, unless it originated in an imported file.
Otherwise, adds a new property in the first property group without a condition, creating a property group if necessary after the last existing property group, else at the start of the project.
Evaluation takes place on a best-effort basis. Properties that are defined in the project source following the new property may be used for evaluation. Only this property is evaluated. Other properties that might depend on it are not affected.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a flag the determines whether ReevaluateIfNecessary is temporarily disabled. This is useful when the host expects to make a number of reads and writes to the project, and wants to temporarily sacrifice correctness for performance.
Docs.value: Returns a flag the determines whether ReevaluateIfNecessary is temporarily disabled.

Docs.summary: Gets the value of the SubToolsetVersion attribute, if any. This value was combined with the value of the ToolsVersion attribute to determine the toolset properties for this project.
Docs.value: Returns the SubToolsetVersion attribute value. Returns an empty string if the attribute is not present.

Docs.summary: Gets a dictionary of all targets in this project, keyed by target name.
Docs.value: Returns a dictionary of all targets in this project, keyed by target name. Overridden targets are not included in this collection. This dictionary is read-only.

Docs.summary: Gets the tools version that this project was evaluated with, if any.
Docs.value: Gets the tools version that this project was evaluated with, if any.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Set by the constructor. This is not necessarily the same as the tools version on the Project tag, if any; it may have been externally specified, for example with a /tv switch on the command line. The actual tools version on the Project tag can be obtained from <xref:Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project.Xml%2A>. The tools version cannot be changed once the project has been created.

Docs.summary: Gets the root project associated with this project. Can never be null
Docs.value: Returns the root project associated with this project, which can never be null.

remarks.format: ## Remarks There is no way to set this property. If you have a new project root, evaluate it into a new project.
